metadata.title: CVE-2022-1016 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel innet/netfilter/nf_tables_core.c:nft_do_chain, which can cause ause-after-free. This issue needs to handle 'return' with properpreconditions, as it can lead to a kernel information leak problem causedby a local, unprivileged attacker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
